sentences.en: In so many countries that I covered in Southeast Asia it was a given that the elites would take over public land as a kind of perquisite of power.
sentences.cn: 在我报道过的许多东南亚国家，精英阶层拥有将公有土地挪为私用的特权，是人尽皆知的常态。

sentences.en: Politics was the perquisite of the upper class B. Sewall.
sentences.cn: 政治是上层阶级的特殊待遇.

sentences.en: Under the perquisite of the everyday, he has reconstructed a personal system of art.
sentences.cn: 在日常性的前提下, 重建了个人的艺术谱系.

words.tran_cn: 额外补贴；临时津贴；特权

trans.tran_cn: （工资以外的）财务补贴，额外收入，（随职位而得到的）好处，利益
